meanings.definition: A person or thing that eradicates.
meanings.sent1: The brave eradicator swiftly removed all the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The exterminator was the eradicator of all the pests in the house.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be an eradicator of monsters under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an eradicator of all his worries.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape billowed behind him as he stood tall, a true eradicator of evil.

meanings.definition: A substance or device used to eliminate or destroy something.
meanings.sent1: The powerful chemical eradicator cleared the drain of any clogs.
meanings.sent2: The antivirus software acted as an eradicator of harmful computer viruses.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand was an eradicator of all the stains on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an eradicator, dispersing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm was an unstoppable eradicator of the old, weak trees in the forest.
